channel.title: MoparScape Help FAQ [Read]
channel.description:
Since the original FAQ topic is a bit dated, I decided to create another one.
[center][u][size=15pt][b]F[/b]requently [b]A[/b]sked [b]Q[/b]uestions[/size][/u][/center]
[b]Q[/b] = Question [b]A[/b] = Answer
[hr] [b]Q[/b]: Where can I learn Java? [color=green][b]A[/b]: You can learn Java [url=http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/index.html]here[/url].
[hr] [b]Q[/b]: How to I start my own private server? [color=green][b]A[/b]: Follow [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html]this[/url] tutorial.
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: How do I port forward? Follow the step in the How to Start a Server tutorial or go to http://portforward.com/.
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: Where do I download Java? [b]A[/b]: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp - it should be the first one listed.
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: When I try to compile my Java files, the compiler prints ''javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command'. How do I fix this? [b]A[/b]: To fix this, you'll need to follow these steps: Set your environmental variables. Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java. We will firstly open 'My Computer' and click 'View System Information'. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says 'Advanced' and at the bottom, click 'Environmental Variables'. Now what you're going to do, is go to your 'Path' and 'Classpath' variables and edit them.
In your Classpath variable, you're going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be: [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code] If a newer version of JDK comes out, change the '7' to the newest update.
After you have done the Classpath variable, you're going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it. [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin;[/code]
[color=green]The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you're going to change the '7' to your current JDK update. Once you've done that, you'll need to edit your compiler batch file code to the one below: [code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause[/code] You'll have to change the '7' once again to the JDK update you have downloaded.
Alternatively, you can use [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,375681.0.html]Lin's Environmental Variable Setter[/url].
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: Where can I find *name here*? [b]A[/b]: Use the [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=search]search feature[/url].
[IMG]http://i771.photobucket.com/albums/xx351/the-soul1/search.jpg[/img]
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: How do I change my player rights? [color=green][b]A[/b]: 317 protocol: find your character folder, and where it says 'character-rights = x', change 'x' to the player rights you want to be. 508 protocol: in the login class, search: [code]if (p.username.equals("[/code] above that, add: [code]if (p.username.equals("NAME")) { p.rights = x; }[/code] change 'x' to the player rights.
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: What are the most common player rights? [b]A[/b]: 0 - normal player 1 - moderator 2 - administrator
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: I'm trying to add commands to my server, but I don't know where to add them. Where do they go? [b]A[/b]: customCommand() method. Search 'customCommand(String command)' and place your command under it.
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: When I run my server it says 'ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException'. How come? [b]A[/b]: This is most likely caused due to a configuration file. Always use tabs in configuration files, not spaces.
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: How do I make certain buttons do things? [b]A[/b]: It's called an action button, and it's handled in the clicking most packet (packet 185). The case label is used as the button's ID, and the code under it will be used to determine what happens when the button is clicked.
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: Where do I find a decent client to use? [b]A[/b]: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,6915.0/topicseen.html
[hr]
[b]Q[/b]: Where can I find a list of decent tutorials? [b]A[/b]: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,381031.0.html
[hr]
[color=red][b]Q[/b]: When I run my server, the batch reads 'Error unable to startup listener on 43594 - port already in use?'. Why? [color=green][b]A[/b]: It's because there's another program occupying the port 43594 already. You need to terminate the connection.
[hr]
This will be updated more tomorrow.
Other FAQs:
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,195700.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,195700.0.html[/url]

item.title: MoparScape Help FAQ [Read]
item.dc:creator: @Lord_dagoth Lord dagoth
item.description:
@Lord_dagoth wrote:

Runserver -
@echo off
title rs2hd compiler
echo Preparing…
mkdir bin
cd src/com
copy log4j.xml …
cd …
move log4j.xml bin
echo Compiling core…
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/Main.java
echo completed…

compile -
@echo off
title Element-X Compiler
echo Preparing…
mkdir bin
cd src/com
copy log4j.xml …
cd …
move log4j.xml bin
echo Compiling core…
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/Main.java
echo Compiling loginserver…
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/Main.java
echo Compiling packet handlers…
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/packethandler/.java
echo Compiling logging system…
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/util/log/SLF4JAppender.java
echo Complete.
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/tools/.java
echo Complete.
pause

The errors i get are these:
Runserver:
Preparing…
A subdirectory or file bin already exists.
1 file(s) copied.
1 file(s) moved.
Compiling core…
javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\Main.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
completed…
running server…
Error: Could not find or load main class com.rs2hd.Main
Press any key to continue . . .
echo running server…
title Server.
java -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar com.rs2hd.Main
pause

and this:
Preparing…
A subdirectory or file bin already exists.
1 file(s) copied.
1 file(s) moved.
Compiling core…
javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\Main.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
completed…
running server…
Error: Could not find or load main class com.rs2hd.Main
Press any key to continue . . .

Help wanted!!

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Help FAQ [Read]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

tkcombo9:

How do i get a source for moparscape 3.2 w/ayran?

MoparScape 3.2 is a 317 client, any source without custom things will work. Also, pushing ‘Start Server’ will automatically start a server for you.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:16, topic:322683”]Ok, then another one:

In the portforward one, instead of just saying portforward tutorial, actually link to it

Also:

When I run my server it says ‘ArrayOutOfBoundsException’. How come?

It’s ArrayIndexOutofBounds, and it’s not caused mosly by cfg files. It’s usually loops that dont have the correct conditionals.[/quote]

Most of the answers provided are in terms that readers may understand without having second thoughts. No need to critique me on that.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Help FAQ [Read]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Ok, then more:

In the portforward one, instead of just saying portforward tutorial, actually link to it

Also:

When I run my server it says 'ArrayOutOfBoundsException'. How come?
It's ArrayIndexOutofBounds, and it's not caused mosly by cfg files. It's usually loops that dont have the correct conditionals.
Q: When I try to compile my Java files, the compiler prints ''javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command'. How do I fix this?
It is not required to set your environmental variables, and instead you can replace "javac" with: "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_1#\bin\javac.exe"

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Help FAQ [Read]

item.description:

Q: How do I edit things for example what happens when I click an object?

Is not a FAQ, and the answer does not show how to edit the things, it only leads to documentation.

Also, have the “List of Tutorials” just lead to the tutorials section.

Lastly, I would sepparate certain 508 and 317 FAQ’s, as they are quite different.

I could provide some of those if you want :)[/quote]

I’m all for people contributing, and thanks for the suggestions.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Help FAQ [Read]
item.dc:creator: @LKCTheReturn LKCTheReturn
item.description:
@LKCTheReturn wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:1, topic:322683”]Since the original FAQ topic is a bit dated, I decided to create another one.

[center][size=15pt]Frequently Asked Questions[/size][/center]

Q = Question
A = Answer

Q: How do I change my player rights?
[color=green]A:
317 protocol: find your character folder, and where it says ‘character-rights = x’, change ‘x’ to the player rights you want to be.
508 protocol: in the login class, search:

if (p.username.equals("

above that, add:

if (p.username.equals("NAME")) { p.rights = x; }
change ‘x’ to the player rights.[/quote]

Not always true for 317’s, I know certain 317’s you have to either edit the administrators text document inside data or add it inside client.java…
But nice FAQ’s,
LKCTheReturn

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Help FAQ [Read]
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“Kingen50cent, post:3, topic:322683”]Lol on the first question it says:
How to I start my own private server?
Replace it with
How do I start my own private server?

And add this question & answer:

[b]Q: How do i make it so only adminstrators can use the food command? (lol lets just say food)

A: 317 Solution: Simply just put the && playerRights >= 2) { Right next to the code if(command.startsWith("food")
And it will turn out like this if(command.startsWith("food")&& playerRights >= 2) {

508 Solution: It’s Simple Just Put The && p.rights > 2) { Right Next to the code } else if(cmd[0].equals("food") And it will turn out like this } else if(cmd[0].equals("food") && p.rights > 0) {[/quote]

That’s not an FAQ. FAQ is Frequently Asked Questions. That’s not so much a frequent question from people.

Read full topic
